oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Infrared-optical double-resonance measurements on O-H center dot center dot center dot H-Ge dihydrogen-bonded phenol-triethylgermanium hydride complex in the gas phase
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, PC
MAITY, DK
PATWARI, GN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: main-group elements
unconventional hydrogen-bonds
borane-dimethylamine complex
ammonia-borane
thermal-decomposition
neutron-diffraction
low-temperature
storage
dehydrogenation
bh3nh3
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Spectroscopic investigation of a dihydrogen-bonded complex between phenol and triethylgermanium hydride is reported here. Laser-induced fluorescence excitation, fluorescence-detected infrared, and IR-UV hole-burning spectroscopic studies were carried out in supersonic jet to investigate the complex formation between phenol and triethylgermanium hydride. The lowering of the O-H stretching frequency of the phenol moiety in the complex with triethylgermanium hydride clearly establishes the role of phenol as hydrogen bond donor. The experimental results together with the ab-initio calculations unambiguously confirm formation of an O-H center dot center dot center dot H-Ge dihydrogen-bonded complex between phenol and triethylgermanium hydride.
